report.title: Charles II, 1660
report.subtitle: Chapter XXVIII. An Act for further suplying and explaining certaine defe&bholigct;s in an A&bholigct; intituled An A&bholigct; for the speedy provision of money for disbanding and paying off the forces of this kingdome both by land and sea. [Rot. Parl. 12 C. II. p. 4. nu. 1.]

section.head: Doubts, &c. respe&bholigct;ing. c. 9. ante.
section.para: c. 10. ante recited.; Reasons for passing this A&bholigct;.; All Persons to pay the several Sums of Money appointed by the said Acts; also 40s. per Cent. on all their Estates Real and Personal.; Proviso for Estates under £5 per Ann.

WHEREAS through some doubts ariseing upon or by negligence in the execution of one A&bholigct; of this present Parliament intituled An A&bholigct; for the speedy provision of money for the disbanding and paying off the forces of this kingdome both by land and sea, and alsoe of one other A&bholigct; intituled An A&bholigct; for supplying and explaining certaine defe&bholigct;s in the aforesaid A&bholigct;, the same A&bholigct;s doe not answere the end&bholngs; aforesaid in such measure as was expe&bholigct;ed without some [further1] explanation of the sence thereof and a review of the severall assessments made thereby, soe that some persons may not escape without payment at all or goe away at very small proportions whilest others pay their just and full due It is therefore ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the Kings most excellent Majestie by and with the consent and advice of the Lord&bholngs; and Commons in Parliament assembled and by the authoritie of the same that all and every person and persons of the severall ranks degrees or qualifications in the said A&bholigct; or A&bholigct;s mentioned shall contribute and pay the severall and respe&bholigct;ive summes of money therin appointed to be paid (any pretence of exemption being the Kings Majestyes servants to the contrary notwithstanding) and alsoe that (2) every person and persons ecclesiasticall and temporall bodyes pollitique and corporate shall pay for their estates both reall and personall the summe of forty shillings for one hundred pound&bholngs; per annum and soe proportionably for a greater or lesser estate, and for every hundred pound&bholngs; personall estate after the rate of five pound&bholngs; per annum provided it extend not to estates under five pound&bholngs; per annum,

section.head: II. The Commissioners named in c. 9. ante to appoint Persons to review the Rates that have been made,
section.para: and thereupon to rate Estates to the full Value.

And to the intent the same may be equally and indifferently assessed and taxed Be it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the authoritie aforesaid that the severall Commissioners in the said A&bholigct; named, or any three of them within their severall and respe&bholigct;ive Countyes Limitts and precin&bholigct;s shall have power to nominate and appoint two or more of the most able or discreet persons in every Parrish Village or Hamlet to review the severall rates and assessments that have beene made in their severall and respe&bholigct;ive Parishes Villages and Hamlets, and where they shall finde that by the negligence or default of any former Assessors any persons or estates have beene underrated or ommitted to be rated, that then they shall rate and assesse all such persons and estates soe underrated or omitted to the full value they are to be rated and assessed at either for their degrees persons or estates by this or the former A&bholigct;s to that purpose made in this present Parliament, or shall by the appointment at the discretion of the said Commissioners make new assessments or rates, and shall returne the same or their said additionall rates at such places and times as the said Commissioners or any three of them shall appoint,

section.head: III. Sworn Clerks in the Exchequer 20 Nobles.
section.para: And it is further ena&bholigct;ed [& declared1] by the authoritie aforesaid that every sworne Attourney or Clerke in the Office of the Clerke of the Pipe in the Exchequer and every Attourney belonging to the Office of the Lord Treasurers Remembrancer shall pay twenty nobles apeece,

section.head: IV. Barristers at Law, and Persons written or writing themselves Esquire, to pay as Esquires.
section.para: And be it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared that every Barrester at Law, and every other person or persons that hath or have subscribed to any deed or writing wherein he or they have beene written or intituled Esquire, or that hath or have a&bholigct;ed by vertue of any Commission or pretended Commission A&bholigct; or pretended A&bholigct;s of Parliament wherein they have before the sitting of this Parliament beene written or entituled Esquire shall pay as reputed Esquiers within the said A&bholigct;s,

section.head: V. Persons having paid, on Certificate of Commissioner to be discharged;
section.para: what such Certificate to express.; Proviso for Persons having paid for Estates in one or more Counties.

And to the intent that none that have or shall pay his or their due proportions that he or they ought to pay in respe&bholigct; of his or their quality or degree may be doubly charged, every person that hath or shall pay his full proportion for his or her degree and quality the same exceeding the proportion of his or her estate reall and personall shall by certificate under the hand&bholngs; and seales of three or more of the Commissioners within the same County or precin&bholigct;s where such summe hath or shall be paid be discharged from further payment for his or her estate soe that it be perticularly expressed in every such certificate where such estate lyeth, and the severall and respe&bholigct;ive values thereof soe that it may appeare that his or her proportion for his or her degree or quality doth exceed that of his or her estate, And alsoe where any person or persons bodyes pollitique or corporate have paid or shall pay for his her or their estate in one or more Countyes he or they shall by like certificate or certificates (3) for soe much and such values specially mentioned to be paid in the said certificates and noe more,

section.head: VI. Power to Commissioners on Oath to inquire and determine concerning Abuses by Assessors, &c. and to fine.
section.para: Proviso that Fines do not exceed £5 for one Offence.; Such Fines may be levied by Distress.; Fines employed as by the said former A&bholigct;s.; Where no Distress can be had, Commissioners may imprison Offender in the Common Gaol till Fine paid.

And be it ena&bholigct;ed and declared by the authoritie aforesaid that the said Commissioners or any three or more of them within their severall precin&bholigct;s shall and may have power to inquire of heare and determine all abuses negcle&bholigct;s and misdoeings of all and every the Assessors and Colle&bholigct;ors to be imployed by vertue of this, or the said precedent A&bholigct;s, and shall have power to impose any fine or fines upon them or any of them whom they shall be well informed (by the oath of two or more credible witnesses, which oath they or any two of them are hereby impowered to administer) to offend from and after the twentyeth day of December One thousand six hundred and sixty in not performing their dutyes in their respe&bholigct;ive imployments, Provided that noe such fine shall exceed the summe of five pound&bholngs; for one offence, and that such Commissioners who shall sett or impose such fine or fines shall have full power by warrant under their hand&bholngs; and seales to command the severall Constables or Tithingmen within the severall and respe&bholigct;ive places where such person or persons have their habitation or abode, upon whom such fine or fines is or are imposed to levy the same by distresse upon the good&bholngs; of such person or persons refuseing to pay the same and to returne the overplus thereof (if any be) dedu&bholigct;ing [alsoe4] reasonable charges for takeing such distresse to the Owner or Owners of such good&bholngs;, And every such fine shall be imployed to the same purposes as the moneyes raised by the said former A&bholigct;s are appointed, And alsoe in case noe distresse can be found or had for satisfieing such fine and in case noe distresse can be taken by the Colle&bholigct;ors or other Officers appointed to distraine for the taxes or assessments by vertue of the said former A&bholigct; or A&bholigct;s, that in every such default upon complaint to the said C&bhooov;missioners or any three of them within their severall and respe&bholigct;ive limitts the said Commissioners or any three of them shall have full power and authoritie to cause every such person from whom noe distresse can be had to be committed to the next common goale there to remaine untill he hath fully satisfied [& paid4] such summe or summes of money which ought to be charged upon him by [vertue of4] this [or5] the said former A&bholigct;s without baile or mainprize,

section.head: VII. Commissioners to make Account of Monies raised in Hundreds, &c. only by former A&bholigct;s and this A&bholigct;, and return the same into the Exchequer before 2d March.
section.para: And be it further ena&bholigct;ed and declared that the Commissioners of every County and place respe&bholigct;ively shall make up a true accompt of the summes onely of every Hundred Lath Wapentake or Ward rated and assessed by the said former A&bholigct;s together with the additionall summes that shall be rated by vertue of this present A&bholigct; severally within their severall Countyes Limitts and Precin&bholigct;s without nameing the perticular persons or estates, and shall shew what hath beene paid thereof and to what person and persons, and what hath beene discharged by such certificates as are appointed by this A&bholigct;, and what is in arreare and unpaid, and shall returne the same into his Majestyes Court of Exchequer before the second day of March next and in soe doeing they shall not be compelled to make [or returne4] any other accompt duplicate or certificate,

section.head: VIII. The full yearly Value of Lands, &c.; to be assessed.
section.para: And it is further ena&bholigct;ed and declared that the true and full yearely value of all Land&bholngs; Tenements Rents Tythes and other hereditaments shall be rated and assessed in manner aforesaid in the severall parishes villages or Hamlets where the same are scituate lyeing or ariseing

section.head: IX. Sums paid under former A&bholigct;s dedu&bholigct;ed out of Charge by this A&bholigct;.
section.para: And be it further declared that every summe charged upon and paid by any person by vertue of the said former A&bholigct;s or either of them by reason of estate degree or quality shall be allowed and dedu&bholigct;ed out of such further charge as shall be imposed upon him or her by vertue of this present A&bholigct;.

section.head: X. Persons sued under this or former A&bholigct;s may plead General Issue.; Double Costs.
section.para: Lastly it is ena&bholigct;ed and declared that whosoever is sued at law for any a&bholigct; done or to be done in the due execution of this or either of the said former A&bholigct;s he may plead the generall issue and give the speciall matter in evidence, and if the plaintiffe be non suite, or a verdi&bholigct; passe against any such plaintiffe or plaintiffes in any such A&bholigct;ion the defendant shall and may recover his double costs,

section.head: XI. Proviso for Peers.
section.para: [Provided alwayes [& be it ena&bholigct;ed4] that this A&bholigct; or any thing therein contained shall not extend to any Peere of this Realme in point of assessment imprisonment distresse or otherwise provision being made in the said first recited A&bholigct; for the assessing of the said Peeres by certaine Peeres who are therein named and appointed in that behalfe,

section.head: XII. Lord Chancellor, &c. added to the Peers named in the said former A&bholigct;s for assessing Peers.
section.para: And be it further ena&bholigct;ed that the Lord Chauncellour the Lord Treasurer, the Lord Steward of his Majesties Household, Lord Chamberlaine of his Majestyes Household, the Earle of Northampton, Lord Howard of Charleton the Lord Roberts the Lord Grey of Warke the Lord Craven the Lord Mohun and the Lord Hatton be added to the Peeres named in the said first recited A&bholigct; for the assessing of the Peeres according to the said recited A&bholigct;,6] [which said Lord&bholngs; Commissioners or any five of them in this and the former A&bholigct; named shall have power to assesse levy and colle&bholigct;, and shall assesse levy and colle&bholigct; all such summes of money as shall be assessed according to the tenor of this and the former A&bholigct; upon such Peeres who have not paid proportionably to their estates.6]

section.head: XII. Commissioners named.
section.para: And be it declared and ena&bholigct;ed by the authority aforesaid that these persons hereafter named shall be added Commissioners for their severall Countyes places and precin&bholigct;s respe&bholigct;ively and shall exercise the same power as if they had beene named in the said former A&bholigct;s or either of them.
Berks
For the County of Berks Peregrine Hobby Richard Harrison Es&bhoqesq; John Fettiplace of Fernham Es&bhoqesq;.

section.note: bee discharged in other places O.
annexed to the Original A&bholigct; in a separate Schedule.
